content.title: Financial Assistance to Mussel Culture and Oyster Farming in Goa
content.department: Department of Fisheries, Government of Goa
content.details: Financial Assistance to Mussel Culture and Oyster Farming in Goa is a scheme by the Department of Fisheries, Government of Goa. Through this scheme, financial assistance is provided to eligible fishermen for setting up units in estuarine waters, and in open sea. The applications are accepted only in offline mode.
benefits: 50% subsidy limited to ₹ 25,000 per unit, maximum for 2 units in estuarine waters.
50% subsidy limited to ₹ 40,000 per unit, maximum for 2 units in open sea.
eligibility: The applicant should be a Fish Farmer/ Individual/ Registered Self Help Groups/ Societies/ Associations, interested in setting up the Mussel Culture/ Oyster Farming Unit in Goa.
The applicant should be a resident of Goa for the last fifteen years.
The applicant should have undergone a training programme on Mussel Culture/ Oyster Farming organized by the Fisheries Department/ MPEDA/ ICAR/ any other institute.
content.application_process: Offline. The interested applicant should take print of the prescribed format of the application form, fill in all mandatory fields, paste the passport-sized photograph, and attach copies of all mandatory documents. Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the concerned authority at the Department of Fisheries, Dayanand Bandodkar Marg, Patto Colony, Panaji Goa - 403 521, or to the official posted at BDO Office/ Sub-Offices of the Department of Fisheries.
documents_required: Documents for the Proof of Availability of Land (if applicable).
Estuarine Unit in River/Open Sea: NOC from Concerned Authority.

faqs.question: What steps are taken to verify the authenticity of training programs attended by applicants?
faqs.answer: Applicants must submit certificates from recognized institutions, and the Fisheries Department may cross-verify with training organizers.

faqs.question: Can the subsidy be availed for units exceeding the specified sizes in estuarine waters and open sea?
faqs.answer: No, the subsidy is limited to ₹25,000 and ₹40,000 per unit for specified sizes in estuarine waters and open sea, respectively.

faqs.question: Are there any exceptions to the fifteen-year residency requirement for applicants?
faqs.answer: No exceptions are mentioned; applicants must be residents of Goa for the last fifteen years.

faqs.question: What specific training programs on Mussel Culture/Oyster Farming are recognized by the Fisheries Department for eligibility?
faqs.answer: Training programs organized by the Fisheries Department, MPEDA, ICAR, or any other recognized institute are accepted.

faqs.question: What is the role of the Directorate of Fisheries in this scheme?
faqs.answer: The Directorate oversees the application process and serves as the contact point for applicants.

faqs.question: Can you provide the link to the Citizen Charter for this scheme?
faqs.answer: Certainly, the Citizen Charter is available at https://fisheries.goa.gov.in/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/CitizenCharter-2.pdf.

faqs.question: How many units can an applicant set up, and what are the subsidy limits?
faqs.answer: Applicants can set up a maximum of 2 units, with a subsidy limit of ₹25,000 per unit for estuarine waters and ₹40,000 per unit for open sea.

faqs.question: Is there a prescribed format for the application form, and where can it be obtained?
faqs.answer: Yes, the application form is available at https://fisheries.goa.gov.in/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Mussel-Oyster-1.pdf.

faqs.question: What are the contact details for the Directorate of Fisheries in Goa?
faqs.answer: Dayanand Bandodkar Marg, Panaji Goa. Tel: (O) 2224838 Tel: (Dir) 2227780; Fax: (0832)2231049. Email: dir-fish.goa@nic.in, Website: www.fisheries.goa.gov.in.

faqs.question: Can you explain the grievance redressal process for this scheme?
faqs.answer: Dissatisfaction or complaints can be registered with the Grievance Redressal Officer at dir-fish.goa@nic.in, and a response will be communicated within 30 days.

faqs.question: What documents are required for applying to the 'Financial Assistance to Mussel Culture and Oyster Farming in Goa' scheme?
faqs.answer: Proof of Identity, 2 Photographs, Proof of Land Availability, Proof of Finance Availability, Detailed Project Report, NOC for Estuarine Unit in River/Open Sea, Certificate of Experience, Expenditure Details, Design/Layout of Unit, and Mandate Form.

faqs.question: Are there alternative submission locations for the application, apart from the Directorate of Fisheries?
faqs.answer: Yes, applicants can submit forms to the official posted at BDO Office/Sub-Offices of the Directorate of Fisheries.
